fields.instructions: Welcome to the Lighter Footprints experiment.

fields.description: Climate-controlled buildings costs a lot of energy. Adjusting the temperature with two degrees saved 2000 pound of CO2 a year.
fields.summary: Heating or cooling buildings less saves energy
fields.name: adjust-thermostat

fields.display_name: Eat locally grown food for lunch
fields.description: The food we eat comes from all over the world. How much CO2 emissions this generates depends on your specific location and menu. On average a person in the USA can save 1400 pounds of CO2 per year by switching to locally grown food. We assume that one lunch is equivalent of 1.5 pounds of CO2 saved.
fields.summary: Less energy for transport when only locally grown food is consumed
fields.name: eat-local-lunch

fields.display_name: Enable sleep function on your computer
fields.description:
Annual energy savings from enabling sleep feature on computer and monitor = 235 kWh
Savings assumes you have an ENERGY STAR computer. It assumes a weighted average of consumer behavior rather than assuming computers are turned off all night.
fields.summary: Your computer consumes less energy when it's asleep or turned off
fields.name: enable-computer-sleep

fields.description: Average number of pounds of CO2 equivalent per person per year that could be saved by recycling glass (6.83), plastic (18.96) and aluminum and steel cans (86.05). This is 2.15 a week.
fields.summary: Recycling processes used materials into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials.
fields.name: recycle

fields.description:
We assume a 22.4 miles per gallon car. CO2 emissions are 19.53 pounds per gallon and 1.5 pound per gallon of non-CO2 CO2 equivalent emissions. This means 0.94 pounds per mile. We assume a trip length of 5 miles.

If there are N carpoolers, the savings are (N-1) / N* 4.7. Hence for N=2 persons, the savings is 2.85. More carpoolers lead to more reductions.
fields.summary: Using mass transit, bicycle commuting, or carpooling is more efficient than traveling alone in your car.
fields.name: share-your-ride

fields.display_name: Bike or take public transportation when you go out
fields.description: We assume a 22.4 miles per gallon car and a 4 mile trip length. CO2 emissions are 19.53 pounds per gallon and 1.5 pound per gallon of non-CO2 CO2 equivalent emissions. This means 0.94 pounds per mile.
fields.summary: Reduce fossil fuel consumption and emissions by not driving a car
fields.name: bike-public-transport

fields.display_name: Turn water off while brushing your teeth
fields.description: 0.5 kWh per person per day, assuming four minutes a day (enough to account for brushing teeth twice daily) and typical energy use for water supply, treatment, and heating. With 1.52 CO2 per kWh this leads to a savings of 0.76 pound of CO2 a day.
fields.summary: Don't leave the water running while you're brushing your teeth
fields.name: brushing-your-teeth

fields.display_name: Turn off your computer at night
fields.description:
The average computer uses about 120 Watts (75 Watts for the screen and 45 Watts for the CPU) whether you're using it or not.
One computer left on 24 hours a day will lead to cost 1,500 pounds of CO2 into the atmosphere.
fields.summary: Save energy and turn off your computer when it's not needed.
fields.name: computer-off

fields.description: Replacing the protein you get from beef with poultry can save you 1,555 pounds of CO2 emissions annually. Per day this switch leads to a 4.26 pounds of CO2 savings.
fields.summary: Beef production is very energy intensive
fields.name: no-beef

fields.description: Average number of pounds of CO2 equivalent per person per year that could be saved by recycling magazines (14.86), newspaper (89.76) and junk mail (100). This is 0.56 pound per day.
fields.summary: Saving paper resources and production by recycling
fields.name: recycle-paper

fields.description: Drying your clothes saves 723 pounds of CO2 every year. This is 1.98 pounds per day.
fields.summary: Air drying your clothes saves gas or electricity
fields.name: air-dry-clothes

fields.description: You can save 500 pounds of CO2 a year by reducing waste at lunch time. This means packing your lunch in a reusable container, using reusable/washable utensils, and don’t use paper napkins.
fields.summary: Reduce the amount of waste you produce at lunch time.
fields.name: green-lunch

fields.description: Per bulb per hour: [60 watts / 1000 watts/kWh] *1.52 pounds of CO2 per kWh = 0.09 pound of CO2 per bulb per hour. Assume turning off 5 bulbs for 5 hours. This leads to 2.28 pounds of CO2 per day.
fields.summary: Turning lights off in areas that don't need it saves energy.
fields.name: lights-off

fields.display_name: Become a vegan for a day
fields.description: A plant-based diet saves 1608 pound of CO2 per year compared to an average diet.
fields.summary: Raising animals for meat is resource intensive
fields.name: vegan-for-a-day

fields.display_name: Wash your clothes with cold water
fields.description: You can save 400 pound of CO2 a year by washing all your clothes with cold water.
fields.summary: Save energy by not heating water
fields.name: wash-cold-water
